name: Evaluating Packages Part 1
description: Turn to community

name: Evaluating Packages Part 2
description: Review repository

name: Small modules: it’s not quite that simple
In Defense of Hyper Modular JavaScript
Tiny npm package: Guidelines to create a Node.js module following the small package philosophy
Why I think "micro-packages" are a good thing.
is-sorted
description: A small module to check if an Array is sorted.

name: array-first
description: Get the first element or first n elements of an array.

name: array-last
description: Return the last element in an array.

name: arr-flatten
description: Recursively flatten an array or arrays.

name: dedupe
description: Remove duplicates from an array.

name: array-range
description: Creates a new array with given range.

name: arr-diff
description: Returns an array with only the unique values from the first array, by excluding all values from additional arrays using strict equality for comparisons.

name: filled-array
description: Returns an array filled with the specified input

name: map-array
description: Map object keys and values into an array.

name: in-array
description: Return true if any of passed values exists in array - faster than using indexOf.

name: unordered-array-remove
description: Efficiently remove an element from an unordered array without doing a splice.

name: array-swap
description: Swap position of two items in an array.

name: mirrarray
description: Creates a keymirror object from an array of valid keys.

name: group-array
description: Group array of objects into lists.

name: array.chunk
description: Split array/TypedArray to chunks of given size.

name: decamelize
description: Convert a camelized string into a lowercased one with a custom separator: unicornRainbow → unicorn_rainbow.

name: pad-left
description: Left pad a string with zeros or a specified string.

name: to-camel-case
description: Convert a string to a camel case.

name: to-capital-case
description: Convert a string to a capital case.

name: to-constant-case
description: Convert a string to a constant case.

name: to-dot-case
description: Convert a string to a dot case.

name: to-no-case
description: Remove an existing case from a string.

name: to-pascal-case
description: Convert a string to a pascal case.

name: to-sentence-case
description: Convert a string to a sentence case.

name: to-snake-case
description: Convert a string to a snake case.

name: to-space-case
description: Convert a string to a space case.

name: to-title-case
description: Convert a string to a title case.

name: node-slug
description: slugifies even utf-8 chars.

name: rtrim
description: Strip whitespace - or other characters - from the end of a string.

name: slice.js
description: Javascript library to enhance String.substring / Array.slice with python slice style.

name: strip-ansi
description: Strip ANSI escape codes.

name: striptags
description: An implementation of PHP's strip_tags in Node.js.

name: parse-next-json-value
description: Parse next JSON value from string allowing extraneous characters after value.

name: pluralize
description: A very tiny library to pluralize words

name: pretty-ms
description: Convert milliseconds to a human readable string: 1337000000 → 15d 11h 23m 20s.

name: hirestime
description: A wrapper around the built-in high resolution timer which simplifies the calculation of timestamps.

name: periods
description: Defined time-periods constants for Javascript, in milliseconds.

name: fecha
description: Javascript Date formatting and parsing.

name: akamai-time-reference
description: Get reference time using Akamai's time reference service.

name: timeago.js
description: A tiny(~1.7kb) library used to format date with *** time ago statement.

name: count-days-in-month
description: Get the number of days in a given month.

name: time-stamp
description: Get a formatted timestamp.

name: twas
description: Generate a relative time string (Example: "3 seconds ago")

name: map-obj
description: Map object keys and values into a new object.

name: filter-obj
description: Filter object keys and values into a new object.

name: object-values
description: Get the values of an object.

name: object-pairs
description: Turn an object into list of [key, value] pairs for mapping, iterating or other purposes.

name: zipmap
description: Returns a map with the keys mapped to the corresponding vals. zipmap also accepts a single value of objects or pairs.

name: just-pluck
description: Pluck without the madness.

name: deep-equal
description: Node's assert.deepEqual() algorithm as a standalone module.

name: deep-assign
description: Recursive Object.assign().

name: set-value
description: Create nested values and any intermediaries dot notation ('a.b.c') paths.

name: get-value
description: Use property paths (a.b.c) to get a nested value from an object.

name: has-value
description: Returns true if a value exists, false if empty. Works with deeply nested values using dot notation ('a.b.c') paths.

name: has-key-deep
description: Deep-search objects for keys. Keys can be searched by providing an array of keys, or using a dot-notiation.

name: flatkeys
description: Flatten object key hierarchies into a list of strings using a custom separator.

name: flatten-obj
description: Converts an object literal with deeply nested nodes to a simple key/value object.

name: is-empty-object
description: Check if an object is empty.

name: stringify-object
description: Stringify an object/array like JSON.stringify just without all the double-quotes.

name: sorted-object
description: Returns a copy of an object with its keys sorted.

name: static-props
description: Defines static object attributes using Object.defineProperties

name: missing-deep-keys
description: Returns an array of keys from first object that are missing in second.

name: has-own-property
description: Check if an object has a local property.

name: merge-objects
description: Deep-merge two objects. Arrays that are values of the same object key get concatenated.

name: deep-object-diff
description: Deep diff two JavaScript Objects while preserving the data structure. Including nested structures of Arrays and Objects.

name: compose-function
description: Compose a new function from smaller functions f(g(x)).

name: curry
description: A curry function without anything too clever.

name: once
description: Run a function exactly one time.

name: deep-bind
description: Bind a context to all functions in an object, including deeply nested functions.

name: identity-function
description: Always return the input argument.

name: mem
description: An optimization technique used to speed up consecutive function calls by caching the result of calls with identical input.

name: throttle-debounce
description: Throttle/debounce your functions.

name: compose-tiny
description: A very tiny and fast compose function.

name: is-even
description: A good way to tell if a number is even or not (avoids type issues). Uses is-odd and is-number under the hood.

name: is-number
description: Returns true if the value is a number.

name: is-odd
description: A good way to tell if a number is odd or not (avoids type issues). Uses is-number under the hood.

name: easy-math.js
description: A tiny easy math library including addition, multiplication, subtraction, and division.

name: my-prime
description: A good way to tell if a number is prime or not.

name: fun-gcd
description: A tiny math library to get gcd of two numbers using Euclidean algorithm

name: through2
description: Tiny wrapper around Node streams2 Transform to avoid explicit subclassing noise.

name: through2-filter
description: A through2 to create an Array.prototype.filter analog for streams.

name: through2-map
description: A through2 to create an Array.prototype.map analog for streams.

name: stream-spigot
description: A readable stream generator, useful for testing or converting simple functions into Readable streams.

name: concat-stream
description: writable stream that concatenates strings or data and calls a callback with the result.

name: JSONStream
description: streaming JSON.parse and stringify

name: through2-map-promise
description: A small promise-based wrapper for through2.

name: pump
description: pipe streams together and close all of them if one of them closes.

name: split
description: Break up a stream and reassemble it so that each line is a chunk.

name: is-stream
description: Check if something is a Node.js stream.

name: syncthrough
description: Transform your data as it pass by, synchronously.

name: pify
description: Promisify a callback-style function.

name: promise-all-props
description: Like Promise.all but for object properties.

name: sleep-promise
description: Resolves a promise after a specified delay.

name: is-promise
description: Test whether an object looks like a promises-a+ promise.

name: quetie
description: Just the cutest and tiniest queue/deque implementation!

name: rimraf
description: A deep deletion module for node (like rm -rf).

name: mkdirp
description: Recursively mkdir, like mkdir -p.

name: du
description: A simple JavaScript implementation of du -sb.

name: file-size
description: Lightweight filesize to human-readable / proportions w/o dependencies.

name: tmp
description: Temporary file and directory creator for node.js.

name: fs-promise
description: Node fs methods as Promise/A+ (optional fs-extra, graceful-fs).

name: read-git-user
description: Reads the username and email from .gitconfig 🔧 and returns it as json object.

name: delegate
description: Lightweight event delegation.

name: insert-css
description: Insert a string of css into the head

name: dom-element-value
description: DOM element value getter/setter.

name: image-promise
description: Load one or more s in a Promise.

name: get-media-size
description: Get the original size of any img/video/svg/canvas tags or canvas context.

name: document-ready
description: Document ready listener for modern browsers.

name: copee
description: Copy text from browser to clipboard...natively!

name: semver
description: The semantic version parser used by npm.

name: semver-max
description: Find maximum (or minimum) version according to semver.

name: semver-first-satisfied
description: Find minimum in an array of version that satisfies a semver range.

name: abbrev
description: Calculate the set of unique abbreviations for a given set of strings.

name: glob
description: Glob functionality for node.js.

name: username
description: Get the username of the current user.

name: minimist
description: Parse argument options.

name: png-to-ico
description: Convert png to windows ico format.

name: help-version
description: Easily handle --help and --version arguments in your CLI application

name: pkg-conf
description: Get namespaced config from the closest package.json.

name: normalize-pkg
description: Normalize values in package.json to improve compatibility, programmatic readability and usefulness with third party libs.

name: is-generator
description: Check whether a given value is a generator function.

name: uuid
description: Generate RFC-compliant UUIDs in JavaScript.

name: node-mime
description: Comprehensive MIME type mapping API based on mime-db module.

name: not-defined
description: Checks if foo is not defined, i.e. undefined, null, an empty string, array or object.

name: is-fqdn
description: Check if a string represent a fully qualified domain name.

name: shurley
description: Parses URLs from user input (with potential typos in protocols, bad copy+paste, etc.) and returns a proper URL.

name: mime-type-check
description: Get the MIME type of a file by its extension.

name: awesome-nodejs
description: A curated list of delightful Node.js packages and resources.

name: awesome-npm
description: Awesome npm resources and tips.
